title: 5,000,000 Cases And Counting: The U.S. Is Still Failing To Contain The Virus
description:
A school district in Georgia learned firsthand last week that the virus is almost impossible to contain — especially without masks and social distancing.

A new effort in New York City encourages travelers to self-isolate when they get into town.

And public health workers in Texas and California explain that the size of the outbreak makes contact tracing a huge challenge.

Find and support your local public radio station.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.

itunes:title: 5,000,000 Cases And Counting: The U.S. Is Still Failing To Contain The Virus
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: While New Zealand hasn't had a case in more than 100 days, the size of the outbreak in the U.S. means it is all but impossible to contain.
itunes:subtitle: While New Zealand hasn't had a case in more than 100 days, the size of the outbreak in the U.S. means it is all but impossible to contain.
